email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding the crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a vessel available, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and LOA of 280m. The laycan is 15-20 October. Starting freight rate is in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the offer. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit on the higher side. Could you consider something in the mid-40s, say $45.50 per metric ton? Also, can you confirm the demurrage rate? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your response. I understand your position, but $45.50 is a bit tight. How about we meet in the middle at $48.00 per metric ton? The demurrage rate is $25,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $48.00 is still a bit high for us. We can stretch to $46.50 per metric ton, but that’s our final offer. Also, can we confirm the laytime is 72 hours total? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your counter. After discussing with the owner, we can accept $46.50 per metric ton. Laytime is confirmed at 72 hours total. Please confirm your acceptance, and I’ll draft the charter party agreement. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, we accept the terms: $46.50 per metric ton, 72 hours laytime, and demurrage at $25,000 per day pro rata. Please proceed with the charter party agreement. Thanks, John
